sen.j: 宝生九郎知栄（ほうしょう くろう ともはる、1837年 - 1917年）は、シテ方宝生流能楽師。
sen.e: Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO (1837 - 1917) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of lead actors (shite-kata).
Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO (1837 - 1917) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of shite-kata (lead actors).
Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO (1837 - 1917) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of shite-kata (lead actors).

sen.j: シテ方宝生流十六世宗家。
sen.e: The 16th head of the Hosho school of lead actors
The 16th head of the Hosho school of shite-kata.
sen.cmt: lead actors→shite-kataとし、ピリオド追加
sen.e: The 16th head of the Hosho school of shite-kata.

sen.j: 維新後の能楽復興に尽力し、初代梅若実、櫻間伴馬とともに明治三名人と謳われる。
sen.e: He contributed to the restoration of Noh art, and was celebrated as "the Three Noh Masters of the Meiji Era" together with Minoru UMEWAKA the 1st and Banma SAKURAMA.
He contributed to the restoration of Noh art, and was celebrated as the Three Noh Masters of the Meiji Period together with Minoru UMEWAKA the First and Banma SAKURAMA.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、Meiji Era→Meiji Period、the 1st→the Firstとしました。
sen.e: He contributed to the restoration of Noh art, and was celebrated as the Three Noh Masters of the Meiji Period together with Minoru UMEWAKA the First and Banma SAKURAMA.
Kuro Shigefusa HOSHO was his son.
Kuro Shigefusa HOSHO was his son.
Kuro Shigefusa HOSHO was his son.
